title: Sensitive Information Disclosure
description: Sensitive information disclosure occurs when the LLM reveals confidential data in its outputs. This can happen through training data memorization, inference attacks, prompt engineering to extract data, or accidental exposure of sensitive information in responses.
detection_patterns: LLM has access to sensitive data sources
No output filtering for sensitive data
Training data includes PII or confidential information
No differential privacy or data anonymization
attack_vectors: Inference attacks to extract training data

mitigations.description: Filter sensitive data from training and inference
mitigations.implementation: Implement data redaction, PII detection and removal, and output filtering to prevent sensitive data disclosure.
Apply differential privacy to training data and model outputs to prevent inference attacks.
Implement output scanning and filtering to detect and redact sensitive data before returning responses.

mitigations.description: Limit access to sensitive data sources
mitigations.implementation: Implement least privilege access controls and data isolation to prevent LLM from accessing unnecessary sensitive data.

references.title: OWASP LLM Top 10 - LLM06: Sensitive Information Disclosure
